intro: Ardisia scoparia, commonly known as the small-leaf evergreen ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Primulaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including India, China, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white to pinkish flowers followed by bright red berries. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal fruiting. Ardisia scoparia prefers shady, moist environments and is commonly found in forest understories.
